model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain information that is both useful and relevant, enabling the Classmates B to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT. PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY is a summary of the previous dialog, and If the MEMORY contains information that conflicts with the PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY, it is not helpful in that context.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY:
Classmate A takes off their belt and dislikes wearing it all day.
Classmate B is working on finishing a history project.
Classmate A is also working on an essay about the Industrial Revolution.
Classmate A shares interesting information about the spinning jenny and its impact on the textile industry.
Classmate B is interested in attending a new technology conference next month.
Classmates A is dedicated to studying hard and taking extra classes to get into a good college.
Classmates A struggled with motivation but found a way to stay focused by thinking about the payoff of their hard work.
Classmates A had a moment of frustration in the past but has learned to channel that energy into studies.
Classmates A's grades are looking good according to their teacher.
Classmates B noticed Classmates A's improvement and acknowledged their hard work.
Classmates A showed up to school in pajamas due to oversleeping after studying late.
Classmates A values being true to themselves and expressing their own style.
Classmates B advises Classmates A to consider how others perceive them, especially in situations like applying to college.
Classmates A believes that if a college rejects them for their style, it's not the right fit.
Classmates A is willing to work hard to achieve their dreams.
Classmates A met the girl of their dreams at a party and have been texting her nonstop.
Classmates B is supportive of Classmates A's new relationship and believes they found someone who makes them happy.
Classmates A is determined to make the relationship work, similar to their determination to get into college.
Classmates A is not afraid to be themselves and embraces their quirks, which their girlfriend appreciates.
Classmates B recalls a funny moment from high school involving Classmates A wearing pajamas to school.
Classmates A feels like everything is falling into place and is excited to see where the new relationship goes.

CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Classmates A:  I attended a really interesting talk today.
Classmates B:  That sounds great. What was the talk about?
Classmates A: It was about the history of the pyramids in Egypt. I learned so much about their construction and the cultural significance they held.
Classmates B: Wow, that does sound interesting. Did you take any notes?
Classmates A: Yes, I took lots of notes. I'm excited to study this topic more on my own time.
Classmates B: That's awesome. It's great to see your enthusiasm for learning.
Classmates A: Thanks. I've always been passionate about learning new things. Remember when we talked about how determined I was to get into college?
Classmates B: Yeah, I remember. You were always studying and taking extra classes.
Classmates A: And now, after all that hard work, I am actually in college. It just goes to show that with dedication, you can achieve your goals.
Classmates B: That's so inspiring. It also reminds me of when you wore your pajamas to school. You were always doing something different and unique.
Classmates A: Haha, yeah, I remember that. But hey, being a little weird sometimes adds some fun and excitement to life. Speaking of exciting things, I met the girl of my dreams a couple of years ago at a party. 

MEMORY 1:
- Classmates A had a moment of frustration in the past but has learned to channel that energy into studies, which caused them to show up to school in pajamas due to oversleeping after studying late.
- Classmates A met the girl of their dreams at a party and have been texting her nonstop, which made them take off their belt and dislike wearing it all day.
- Classmates A is dedicated to studying hard and taking extra classes to get into a good college, wanting to work hard to achieve their dreams, and not being afraid to be themselves and embracing their quirks, which their girlfriend appreciates.

MEMORY 2:

Why did you decide to wear them? ### Classmates A: I was up late studying and I overslept. I didn't have time to change before leaving for school. ### Classmates B: Hmm, that's understandable. I figured it was better to show up in something than not show up at all. ### Classmates B: I see your point. But don't you think you're giving people a reason to talk about you? You're already seen as a bit weird by some people. ### Classmates A: Yeah, I know. But I'm not going to change who I am just to fit in. I want to be able to express myself and be true to my own style. ### Classmates B: I understand that, but sometimes it's important to think about how other people perceive you. Especially if you're trying to get into college. You don't want to give them a reason to reject you because of a bad first impression. ### Classmates A: I see your point, but I also think that if a college is going to reject me because of the way I dress, then it's not the right college for me. ### Classmates B: Fair enough. But just remember, you're not always going to be in a situation where you can be yourself without consequences. ### Classmates A:  Yeah, I know. But I also think that being true to myself is important, even if it means being a little weird sometimes.' }
